definition: bearer of good news (esp. announcing success in imperial examinations)
to announce/to inform/report/newspaper/recompense/revenge/CL:份[fen4],張|张[zhang1]
(noun suffix)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Her article came out in yesterday's newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 她的文章刊登在昨天的报子上。

sentences.english: Newspapers are the most widely used advertising medium.
sentences.chinese: 报子是最为广泛运用的广告媒介。

sentences.english: The newspaper article set me thinking.
sentences.chinese: 这份报子引起我的思考。

definition: doorway/gate/entrance
tip given on a happy occasion (traditional)
to announce good news in red letters
forced labor of feudal tenant (corvée)/bailiff of feudal yamen
notification/memorial
flag or banner
bearer of good news (esp. announcing success in imperial examinations)
see 挨家挨戶|挨家挨户[ai1 jia1 ai1 hu4]
door/doorman (old)/hanger-on of an aristocrat/social influence/pull/classifier for relatives, marriages etc
(old) waiter/attendant
folk art consisting of storytelling to music
to hang on to and serve the rich and powerful by literary hack work etc
to congratulate
double happiness/the combined symmetric character 囍 (similar to 喜喜) as symbol of good luck, esp. marriage
guest (to a wedding etc)
to bow respectfully with clasped hands/to beg humbly
